Articles.Content: This thread will feature only space shuttles, you can post recreations and original designs. There is one catch, the spacecraft must have the ability to fly to space.
I think he means NASA STS equivalents. So Rocket propelled ascent with the nose initialy pointed straigt up and an landing on a runway. I interpret "ability to fly to space" with "no suborbitals"

I think he means NASA STS equivalents. So Rocket propelled ascent with the nose initialy pointed straigt up and an landing on a runway. I interpret "ability to fly to space" with "no suborbitals"

I was practically thinking the opposite since making a "shuttle" in the STS sense is what is being done in at least two more threads here.
I think what you are looking for can be found in [thread=63045]this shuttle thread[/thread].

SOOO would this count?
